trans-unit.source: Provides methods and properties that manage axes in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control.

This class encapsulates all the functionality for axes in the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control, and is exposed by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.AxisX%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.AxisY%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.AxisX2%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.AxisY2%2A> properties of <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> objects.
For all charts—except bar, stacked bar, pie and doughnut—the primary and secondary axes are as follows:
Axis Type
Description
Primary X-Axis
Bottom horizontal axis.
Secondary X-Axis
Top horizontal axis.
Primary Y-Axis
Left vertical axis.
Secondary Y-Axis
Right vertical axis.
Bar and stacked-bar charts have their axes rotated 90 degrees clockwise, so the primary X axis for these two chart types is the left-vertical axis.
**Note** There can be only one set of axes—two vertical and two horizontal—for each <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis> class also contains several methods that can be used to convert axis values to absolute pixel coordinates, which are useful for 2D custom drawing, or to relative coordinates, which are useful for 3D custom drawing.
Absolute and relative coordinates can also be converted to axis values.
The following are the most important axis elements exposed by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis> class:
Axis Element
Description
Axis Labels
The labels of an axis, and their associated properties.
Grid Lines
The major and minor grid lines of an axis.
Tick Marks
The major and minor tick marks of an axis.
Strip Lines
Strip lines.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified ChartArea and axisTypeName values.
The chart area that the axis is drawn to.
The axis type name.
Gets or sets the arrow style of a two-dimensional (2D) axis; this style is not applied to three-dimensional (3D) chart areas.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisArrowStyle"></xref> enumeration value that specifies the arrow style of a 2D axis.
Gets the name of the axis, which can be either X, Y, X2 or Y2.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisName"></xref> enumeration value that represents the name of the axis.
Gets or sets the location at which an axis is crossed by its associated axis.

Setting this property for a primary axis will determine where the other primary axis crosses it, and similarly setting it for a secondary axis will determine where the other secondary axis crosses it.
For example, setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.Crossing%2A> property of the primary X-axis determines where the primary Y-axis will cross it.
Four modes can be used for the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.Crossing%2A> property of an axis:
"Auto", which means that the crossing value will be set to the minimum or maximum value for the relevant axis.
If the axis is primary, the value will be its minimum value, if the axis is secondary it will its maximum value.
To set to "Auto" at run time, use a <xref:System.Double.NaN> value.
"Minimum", which means the crossing value of the axis will be its minimum value.
To set to "Minimum" at run-time use a <xref:System.Double.MinValue> value.
"Maximum", which means the crossing value of the axis will be its maximum value.
To set to "Maximum" at run-time use a <xref:System.Double.MaxValue> value.
A specified `double` value that is between the minimum and maximum values for the relevant axis.
If the crossing value is less then minimum value, or the crossing value is greater than maximum value, an exception will be thrown.

When a non-default crossing value is used, the labels and tick marks of the axis may or may not follow the crossing axis, depending on the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.IsMarksNextToAxis%2A> property setting.
By default they will move with the crossing axis.
A `double` value that represents where an axis is crossed by its associated axis.
The default value is <xref href="System.Double.NaN"></xref>.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabelsCollection"></xref> object used to store <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel"></xref> objects.
Use this property to add or remove custom labels for an axis.
Using <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel> objects enables the developer to arbitrarily set the text for axis labels.
Only custom labels can be used in the second row of labels.
Also, if a custom label is used in the first label row, then all labels in this first row must be custom labels.
Labels can also be set from the data points, or generated automatically from the axis scale.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabelsCollection"></xref> object used to store <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel"></xref> objects.
Releases unmanaged and, optionally, managed resources.
`true` to release both unmanaged and managed resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether an axis is enabled.
If an axis is not enabled, the axis, along with its attributes (tick marks, strip lines, labels, and so forth), will not be displayed.

If an axis is enabled, the axis, along with all its attributes (tick marks, strip lines, labels, and so forth), will be displayed regardless of whether or not it is being used to plot a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series>.

If a value of <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisEnabled.Auto> is used, an axis may or may not be displayed, depending on whether it is being used to plot a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series>.

The axes that are used to plot data are determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.XAxisType%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.YAxisType%2A> property settings.
If an axis is not enabled but an adjacent axis is using grid lines, one of those grid lines will be displayed in place of the axis that is not enabled.

The same situation will occur if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.Enabled%2A> property of an axis is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisEnabled.Auto>, but the axis is not being used to plot data; the grid line of an adjacent axis will be drawn instead.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisEnabled"></xref> enumeration value that indicates whether an axis is enabled.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisEnabled.Auto"></xref>.
Converts an axis value to a relative position (0-100%).
If an axis is logarithmic, the value is converted to a linear scale.
The axis value to be converted.
A `double` value that represents the relative position (0-100%).
Gets or sets the color of interlaced strip lines.
Use this property to specify the color of interlaced strip lines that are displayed when you invoke the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.InterlacedColor%2A> property.

To specify the border color of the interlaced strip lines, you must display the strips using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.StripLines%2A> collection property instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.InterlacedColor%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> object that represents the color of interlaced strip lines.
Gets or sets the interval of an axis.

This property determines how often the labels and major tick marks and grid lines associated with the axis are drawn if the `Interval` property value of a label, tick mark, or grid line is set to <xref:System.Double.NaN>, which signifies that it is not set.

The `Interval` property of a major tick mark, grid line or label of the axis has priority over the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.Interval%2A> property setting of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis> object.
A value of zero represents an "Auto" value.
This <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.Interval%2A> property cannot be set to <xref:System.Double.NaN>.
If you assign this property a value of <xref:System.Double.NaN>, a value of zero will be used instead.
**Note** The minor grid lines and tick marks of an axis never use this property for their interval.
The interval type of the axis is determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.IntervalType%2A> property.
A `double` value that represents the interval of an axis.
The default value is "Auto", which is represented by a value of zero (0).
Gets or sets a flag that determines if a fixed number of intervals is used on the axis, or if the number of intervals depends on the axis size.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.Interval%2A> property is set to "Auto", the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.IntervalAutoMode%2A> property determines how many intervals should be calculated.

If your chart is resized or redrawn often, you can set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.IntervalAutoMode%2A> property to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.IntervalAutoMode.VariableCount>, in which case the chart will dynamically calculate axis intervals.
This is especially useful in situations where the chart intervals are displayed differently, depending on their data.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.IntervalAutoMode"></xref> enumeration value that determines how the number of intervals is used on the axis.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.IntervalAutoMode.FixedCount"></xref>.
Gets or sets the interval offset of an axis.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.IntervalOffset%2A> property determines the interval offset of an axis.

This value is used as the interval offset of an axis' labels and the major tick marks and grid lines associated with the axis if the `IntervalOffset` property value of the labels, tick marks, or grid lines is not set, which is represented by a value of <xref:System.Double.NaN>.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.IntervalOffset%2A> property of the tick marks, labels and grid lines of an axis has priority over the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.IntervalOffset%2A> property setting of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis> object.
A value of zero represents an "Auto" value.
Also, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.Interval%2A> cannot be set to not set (that is, a <xref:System.Double.NaN>).
If you assign <xref:System.Double.NaN>, a value of "Auto"—that is, a value of zero—will be used instead.
**Note** The minor grid lines and tick marks of an axis never use this property for their interval offset.
The interval offset type of the axis is determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.IntervalOffsetType%2A> property.
A `double` value that represents the interval offset of an axis.
The default value is "Auto", which is represented by a value of zero (0).
Gets or sets the interval offset type of an axis.
This property determines the interval offset type of an axis.

It is used for the interval offset type of an axis' labels, major tick marks, and grid lines if the axis element's own `IntervalOffsetType` property value is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DateTimeIntervalType.NotSet>.

Setting this property to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DateTimeIntervalType.NotSet> will result in a value of <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DateTimeIntervalType.Auto> being used (only the axis elements such as major grid lines, etc. can be set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DateTimeIntervalType.NotSet>).
The minor grid lines and tick marks of an axis never use this property for their interval offset type.
The interval of the axis is determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.IntervalOffset%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DateTimeIntervalType"></xref> that represents the interval offset type of an axis.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DateTimeIntervalType.Auto"></xref>.
Gets or sets the interval type of an axis.
This property determines the interval type of an axis.

It is used for the interval type of an axis' labels, major tick marks, and major grid lines if the axis element's own `IntervalType` property value is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DateTimeIntervalType.NotSet>.

Setting this property to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DateTimeIntervalType.NotSet> will result in a value of <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DateTimeIntervalType.Auto> being used.
Only the axis elements, such as grid lines, can be set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DateTimeIntervalType.NotSet>.
**Note** The minor grid lines and tick marks of an axis never use this property for their interval type.
The interval of the axis is determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.Interval%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DateTimeIntervalType"></xref> that represents the interval type of an axis.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DateTimeIntervalType.Auto"></xref>.
Gets or sets a flag that determines if interlaced strip lines are displayed for an axis.
`true` if interlaced strip lines are displayed for an axis; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a flag that determines whether axis labels are automatically fitted.
`true` if axis labels are automatically fitted; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a flag which indicates whether the axis is logarithmic.
Zeros or negative data values are not allowed on logarithmic charts.
`true` if the axis is logarithmic; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a flag that determines whether an axis margin will be used.
`true` if a space is added between the first or last data point and the border of chart area; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a flag that determines whether tick marks and axis labels move with an axis if the crossing point of an axis changes.
`true` if tick marks and axis labels move with an axis when the crossing point of an axis changes; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a flag which indicates whether the axis is reversed.
If set to reversed, the values on the axis are in reversed sort order and the direction of values on the axis is flipped.
`true` if the axis is reversed; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a flag which indicates whether the minimum value of the axis will be automatically set to zero if all data point values are positive.
If there are negative data point values, the minimum value of the data points will be used.
`true` if the minimum value of the axis is automatically set to zero when all data point values are positive; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the maximum font size that can be used by the label auto-fitting algorithm.
The font size cannot be less than 5.
An `integer` value that specifies the maximum font size that can be used by the label auto-fitting algorithm.
Gets or sets the minimum font size that can be used by the label auto-fitting algorithm.
An `integer` value that specifies the minimum font size that can be used by the label auto-fitting algorithm.
Gets or sets the allowable label changes that can be made to enable the label to be fit along an axis.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.IsLabelAutoFit%2A> property must be set to `true`.

A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LabelAutoFitStyles"></xref> enumeration value that specifies the allowable label changes that can be made to enable the label to be fit along an axis.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LabelStyle"></xref> properties of an axis.
Use this property to specify the style, formatting, and so forth, of axis labels.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.IsLabelAutoFit%2A> property is `true`, the font size, font angle and the use of offset labels are determined automatically.

If you set any one of the LabelStyle.Font.Size, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LabelStyle.Angle%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LabelStyle.IsStaggered%2A> properties, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.IsLabelAutoFit%2A> property will be set to `false`.

Note that if a format that consists of a date without a time is used for labels, and the <xref:System.DateTime> data point values that are used specify times, the times will affect the positions of the data points, even though they are not displayed due to the label formatting.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LabelStyle"></xref> object, which defines the axis label style.
Gets or sets the line color of an axis.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.LineColor%2A> property to specify the line color of an axis.
**Note** If an axis is not enabled but an adjacent axis is using grid lines, one of those grid lines will be displayed in place of the axis that is not enabled.
The same situation will occur if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.Enabled%2A> property of an axis is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisEnabled.Auto>.
In this case, the axis is not being used to plot data, and the grid line of an adjacent axis will be drawn instead.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> object that represents the line color used to draw the axis.
The default is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Black"></xref>.
Gets or sets the line style of an axis.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.LineDashStyle%2A> property determines the line style used for an axis.
The line can be solid, dotted, and so forth.
**Note** If an axis is not enabled but an adjacent axis is using grid lines, one of those grid lines will be displayed in place of the axis that is not enabled.
The same situation will occur if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.Enabled%2A> property of an axis is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisEnabled.Auto>.
In this case, the axis is not being used to plot data, and the grid line of an adjacent axis will be drawn instead.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartDashStyle"></xref> enumeration value that represents the line style of an axis.
Gets or sets the line width of an axis, in pixels.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.LineWidth%2A> property gets or sets the width of an axis line, in pixels.
If the width is set to zero (0), the line will not be displayed.
**Note** If an axis is not enabled but an adjacent axis is using grid lines, one of those grid lines will be displayed in place of the axis that is not enabled.
The same situation will occur if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.Enabled%2A> property of an axis is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisEnabled.Auto>.
In this case, the axis is not being used to plot data, and the grid line of an adjacent axis will be drawn instead.
An `integer` value that represents the width of an axis line.
The default value is one (1) pixel.
Gets or sets a value for the logarithm base for the logarithmic axis.
This property only has an effect when the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.IsLogarithmic%2A> property is set to `true`.
Note that this property is only applicable to value axes, which are used to plot data.
Setting this property for a categorical axis will result in an exception being thrown.
A `double` value that represents the logarithm base value for the logarithmic axis.
The default value is base 10.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Grid"></xref> object used to set the major grid line properties for an axis.
Major grid lines are always drawn in conjunction with a data point.
That is, they will occur at the same point along an axis as a data point, for categorical axis tick marks.
For value axes, major grid lines by default are drawn wherever labels occur.
You can use this property to change major grid line frequency, color, and so forth.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Grid"></xref> object used to get or set the major grid properties of an axis.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TickMark"></xref> object used to set the major tick mark properties of an axis.
Major tick marks are always drawn in conjunction with a data point.
Categorical axis tick marks will occur at the same point along an axis as a data point.
For value axes, major tick marks are drawn by default wherever labels occur.
You can use this property to change the major tick mark properties such as frequency, color, or size.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TickMark"></xref> object used to set the properties of a major tick mark of an axis.
Gets or sets the map area attributes of an axis.
A client side image map will automatically be created if you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.MapAreaAttributes%2A> property.
A map area will be created with the attribute string appended to the \<MAP> tag that corresponds to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis> object for which this property is set.
A `string` value that represents the map area attributes of an axis.
Gets or sets the maximum value of an axis.
To automatically round the maximum and minimum axis values call the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.RoundAxisValues%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.Maximum%2A> value must be greater than the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.Minimum%2A> value.
A `double` value that represents the maximum value of an axis.
The default value is <xref href="System.Double.NaN"></xref>.
Gets or sets the maximum size of the axis, measured as a percentage of the chart area.
This value is used by the automatic layout algorithm.
A `float` value that represents the maximum size of the axis.
Gets or sets the minimum value of an axis.
Note that if you set this value explicitly, the X-values of data elements must be taken into account.
If all data points have X-values of zero, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control will assume the first data point occurs at zero.

Also, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.Minimum%2A> value is explicitly set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.IsStartedFromZero%2A> property will be ignored.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.Minimum%2A> value must be less than the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.Maximum%2A> value.
To automatically round the maximum and minimum axis values.
call the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.RoundAxisValues%2A> method.
A `double` value that represents the minimum value of an axis.
The default value is <xref href="System.Double.NaN"></xref>.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Grid"></xref> object used to specify the minor grid lines attributes of an axis.
Minor grid lines are drawn in between the major grid lines.
Use this property to change the attributes of a minor grid line, such as frequency, color, and so forth.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Grid"></xref> object used to get or set the attributes of the minor grid lines of an axis.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TickMark"></xref> object used to set the minor tick mark properties of an axis.
Minor tick marks should be drawn between major tick marks, where labels usually occur.
Use this property to change the minor tick mark frequency, color, and so forth.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TickMark"></xref> object used for the minor tick mark properties of an axis.
Gets or sets the name of the axis.
A `string` value that represents the text name of the axis.
Converts an absolute pixel position along an axis to an axis value.
This method only works in paint events.
The pixel position to be converted.
A `double` value that represents the axis value.
Converts a relative coordinate along an axis to an axis value.
This method only works in paint events.
The relative position (0-100%) to be converted.
A `double` value that represents the axis value.
Gets or sets the postback value that can be processed on a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Click"></xref> event.
The `string` value to send back to the server.
Automatically rounds axis values.
Call the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.RoundAxisValues%2A> method to round the values of an axis.
Note that the interval used for the axis will not be changed when this method is called.
This method is only supported for the X and X2 axes.
The Y and Y2 axes values are rounded by default.
Gets or sets the axis automatic scale break style.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisScaleBreakStyle"></xref> object, which represents a scale break on the chart axis.
Gets or sets the view of an axis.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisScaleView"></xref> object, which represents the scale view of an axis.

Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.StripLinesCollection"></xref> collection object, which stores all <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.StripLine"></xref> objects for an axis.
Strip lines are used to draw rectangular strips across a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object, and are always drawn across the entire \<A href="">area.
These strip lines are not related to the grid lines.

A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.StripLinesCollection"></xref> collection object, which stores all <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.StripLine"></xref> objects for an axis.
Gets or sets the orientation of the text in the axis title.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TextOrientation"></xref> enumeration value that specifies the orientation of the text in the axis title.
Gets or sets the title of the axis.
Gets or sets the title of the axis.
You can set the font properties of the title using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.TitleFont%2A> property.
You can set the color of the title using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.TitleForeColor%2A> property.
A `string` value that represents the title of the axis.
Gets or sets the alignment of an axis title.
Possible alignment values are <xref:System.Drawing.StringAlignment.Center>, <xref:System.Drawing.StringAlignment.Far>, and <xref:System.Drawing.StringAlignment.Near>.
A value of <xref:System.Drawing.StringAlignment.Far> equates to an alignment to the top or the right, depending on the orientation of the axis or strip line.
In the same manner, a value of <xref:System.Drawing.StringAlignment.Near> equates to an alignment to the bottom or the right.

If you want more control over the positioning of an axis title, you must perform custom drawing using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.PostPaint> or <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.PrePaint> event.

You can further align and position the titles of <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.StripLine> objects by using their <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.StripLine.TextLineAlignment%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.StringAlignment"></xref> enumeration value that specifies the alignment of an axis title.
Gets or sets the title font properties of an axis.
Gets or sets title font properties such as face or size.
To set font properties at run time, a new <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.AnnotationGroup.Font%2A> object must be created.
Any attempt to change the properties of the current <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.AnnotationGroup.Font%2A> object at run time will result in a compilation error.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> object used for the font properties of a title.
Gets or sets the text color of an axis title.
Gets or sets the text color of an <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis> object title.
You can use any valid ARGB (alpha, red, green, blue) color.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that specifies the text color of an axis title.
The default color is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Black"></xref>.
Gets or sets the tooltip used for the axis.
A `string` value that represents the tooltip used for the axis.
Gets or sets the URL target of the axis.
A `string` value that represents the URL target of the axis.
Converts an axis value to an absolute coordinate along an axis.
Measured in pixels.
This method only works in paint events.
The axis value to be converted.
A `double` value that represents the pixel position.
Converts an axis value to its relative position (0-100%).
If an axis has a logarithmic scale, the value is converted to a linear scale.
This method only works in paint events.
The axis value to be converted.
A `double` value that represents the relative position (0-100%).
